semesters.name: Semester 2
semesters.description: Foundation semester covering mathematical methods, data structures, electrical theory, and programming fundamentals

subjects.title: Method of Mathematics
subjects.description: Mathematical foundations including calculus, linear algebra, discrete mathematics, and statistical methods for computer science applications

subjects.title: Data Structures and Algorithms
subjects.description: Fundamental data structures (arrays, linked lists, trees, graphs) and algorithmic techniques including sorting, searching, and complexity analysis

subjects.title: Theory of Electricity
subjects.description: Basic electrical principles including DC/AC circuits, Ohm's law, Kirchhoff's laws, capacitors, inductors, and electrical measurements

subjects.title: Computer Organization & Digital Design
subjects.description: Computer hardware fundamentals including digital logic, Boolean algebra, combinational and sequential circuits, and basic computer organization

subjects.title: Program Construction
subjects.description: Software development principles including object-oriented programming, design patterns, debugging, testing, and software engineering practices

subjects.title: Communication Skills
subjects.description: Essential communication skills for engineers including technical writing, presentation skills, interpersonal communication, and professional correspondence

semesters.name: Semester 3
semesters.description: Advanced semester focusing on AI, computer architecture, database systems, and core engineering principles

subjects.title: Artificial Intelligence
subjects.description: Introduction to AI concepts including search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning fundamentals, neural networks, and expert systems

subjects.title: Computer Architecture
subjects.description: Advanced computer hardware concepts including CPU design, memory hierarchies, instruction sets, pipelining, and performance optimization

subjects.title: Thermodynamics
subjects.description: Heat transfer principles, thermodynamic processes, energy conversion, entropy, and applications in engineering systems and computing hardware

subjects.title: Database Systems
subjects.description: Database design principles, relational models, SQL, normalization, transaction management, and database management system concepts

subjects.title: Differential Equations
subjects.description: Advanced mathematics covering ordinary and partial differential equations, Laplace transforms, and their applications in engineering problems

subjects.title: Operating Systems
subjects.description: OS fundamentals including process management, memory management, file systems, scheduling algorithms, and system security concepts

subjects.title: Communication Skills
subjects.description: Advanced communication skills including technical documentation, project presentations, team collaboration, and professional ethics in engineering

subjects.title: Applied Statics
subjects.description: Fundamental principles of statics including force systems, equilibrium, structural analysis, trusses, and engineering mechanics applications
